alert.note: Alert for Oregon Lower Treasure Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 08 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Washington and northeastern Malheur Counties through 630 PM MDT... At 600 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Moores Hollow, or 10 miles southwest of Weiser, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Indian Head Mountain around 610 PM MDT. Weiser and Annex around 620 PM MDT. Henley Basin around 630 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
